Description: Necklace: a long string of very thin black glazed steatite disc and short barrel beads and, in the centre, one cornelian lenticular bead, a flattened long truncated convex bicone in shape.
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1899,1017.6 & 1899,1017.7), bracelet (1899,1017.5). Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Diospolis Parva: the Cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. 1898-9’ (London, 1901), 45-9, describes the Pan Grave burials without grave X 58 being specifically mentioned.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (594)
